member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ItemNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can never be null.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ItemCanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can be null.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ValueProviderAttribute
member.summary: For a parameter that is expected to be one of the limited set of values. Specify fields of which type should be used as values for this parameter.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of .

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally (throws or terminates the process).
Value canbenull is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon. There is no notion of order rows, all rows are checked for applicability and applied per each program state tracked by R# analysis.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("=> true, result: notnull; => false, result: null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.MustUseReturnValueAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the return value of method invocation must be used.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.ProvidesContextAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the type member or parameter of some type, that should be used instead of all other ways to get the value that type. This annotation is useful when you have some "context" value evaluated and stored somewhere, meaning that all other ways to get this value must be consolidated with existing one.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.SourceTemplateAttribute
member.summary: An extension method marked with this attribute is processed by ReSharper code completion as a 'Source Template'. When extension method is completed over some expression, it's source code is automatically expanded like a template at call site.
member.remarks: Template method body can contain valid source code and/or special comments starting with '$'. Text inside these comments is added as source code when the template is applied. Template parameters can be used either as additional method parameters or as identifiers wrapped in two '$' signs. Use the attribute to specify macros for parameters.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.MacroAttribute
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro for a parameter of a source template.
member.remarks: You can apply the attribute on the whole method or on any of its additional parameters. The macro expression is defined in the property. When applied on a method, the target template parameter is defined in the property. To apply the macro silently for the parameter, set the property value = -1.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro that will be executed for a source template parameter when the template is expanded.

members.member:
Allows specifying which occurrence of the target parameter becomes editable when the template is deployed.
If the target parameter is used several times in the template, only one occurrence becomes editable; other occurrences are changed synchronously. To specify the zero-based index of the editable occurrence, use values >= 0. To make the parameter non-editable when the template is expanded, use -1. >

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Target
member.summary: Identifies the target parameter of a source template if the is applied on a template method.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcSuppressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcViewComponentAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component name.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcViewComponentViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component view. If applied to a method, the MVC view component view name is default.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String).

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.CollectionAccessAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how method, constructor invocation or property access over collection type affects content of the collection.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.None
member.summary: Method does not use or modify content of the collection.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.Read
member.summary: Method only reads content of the collection but does not modify it.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.ModifyExistingContent
member.summary: Method can change content of the collection but does not add new elements.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent
member.summary: Method can add new elements to the collection.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisfies the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to true.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to false.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to null value.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.RegexPatternAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that parameter is regular expression pattern.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.NoReorderAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the Member Reordering feature from tossing members of the marked class.
member.remarks: The attribute must be mentioned in your member reordering patterns

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.XamlItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the type that has ItemsSource property and should be treated as ItemsControl-derived type, to enable inner items DataContext type resolve.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Annotations.XamlItemBindingOfItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the property of some BindingBase-derived type, that is used to bind some item of ItemsControl-derived type. This annotation will enable the DataContext type resolve for XAML bindings for such properties.
member.remarks: Property should have the tree ancestor of the ItemsControl type or marked with the attribute.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Importer.GpxFileSystem.Decompress(AlphaTab.IO.BitReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decompresses the given bitinput using the GPX compression format. Only use this method if you are sure the binary data is compressed using the GPX format. Otherwise unexpected behavior can occure.
member.param: the bitInput to read the data from
true if the header should NOT be included in the result byteset, otherwise false
member.returns: the decompressed byte data. if skipHeader is set to false the BCFS header is included.

member.summary: This public class contains some utilities for working with model public classes

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode
member.summary: Lists the modes how accidentals are handled for notes

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.Default
member.summary: Accidentals are calculated automatically.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.SwapAccidentals
member.summary: If the default behavior calculates a Sharp, use flat instead (and vice versa).

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceNatural
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Naturalize.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceSharp
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Sharp.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceFlat
member.summary: This will move the note one line up and applies a Flat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Note
member.summary: A note is a single played sound on a fretted instrument. It consists of a fret offset and a string on which the note is played on. It also can be modified by a lot of different effects.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.Note.GlobalNoteId
member.summary: This is a global counter for all notes. We use it at several locations for lookup tables.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.String
member.summary: Gets or sets the string number where the note is placed. 1 is the lowest string on the guitar and the bottom line on the tablature. It then increases the the number of strings on available on the track.

member.summary: Lists all types of pick strokes.

member.summary: a list of masterbars which close the group.

member.summary: This public class describes a single track or instrument of score

member.summary: Get or set the guitar tuning of the guitar. This tuning also indicates the number of strings shown in the guitar tablature. Unlike the property this array directly represents the order of the tracks shown in the tablature. The first item is the most top tablature line.

member.summary: This public enumeration lists all feels of triplets.

member.summary: This public class represents a predefined string tuning.

members.member: Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator. Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator.

member.summary: This public enum lists all vibrato types that can be performed.

member.summary: A voice represents a group of beats that can be played during a bar.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating blocks which can render bars.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.IsLinkedToPrevious
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this renderer is linked to the next one by some glyphs like a vibrato effect

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.TopPadding
member.summary: Gets the top padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation start.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.BottomPadding
member.summary: Gets the bottom padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation end.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition
member.summary: Lists the different position modes for

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PreNotes
member.summary: Gets the pre-notes position which is located before the accidentals

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.OnNotes
member.summary: Gets the on-notes position which is located after the accidentals but before the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PostNotes
member.summary: Get the post-notes position which is located at after the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.EndBeat
member.summary: Get the end-beat position which is located at the end of the beat. This position is almost equal to the pre-notes position of the next beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererFactory
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating factories providing BarRenderers

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing
member.summary: Lists all sizing types of the effect bar glyphs

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SinglePreBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the pre-beat glyph which is before the actual note in the area where also accidentals are renderered.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SingleOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph which is where the actual note head glyphs are placed.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedBeforeBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.FullBar
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed on the whole bar covering the whole width

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarRenderer
member.summary: This renderer is responsible for displaying effects above or below the other staves like the vibrato.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph
member.summary: Effect-Glyphs implementing this public interface get notified as they are expanded over multiple beats.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.Beat
member.summary: Gets or sets the beat where the glyph belongs to.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.NextGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the next glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.PreviousGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the previous glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.Glyph
member.summary: A glyph is a single symbol which can be added to a GlyphBarRenderer for automated layouting and drawing of stacked symbols.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GlyphGroup
member.summary: This glyph allows to group several other glyphs to be drawn at the same x position

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithPrevious
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with a previous glyph for rendering. This means this glyph will not be rendered itself, but rendered as part of the very first glyph of this link-group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithNext
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with the next glyph for rendering.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.SpacingGlyph
member.summary: This simple glyph allows to put an empty region in to a BarRenderer.

member.summary: paints a tie between the two given points

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.VoiceContainerGlyph
member.summary: This glyph acts as container for handling multiple voice rendering

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo
member.summary: A public class implementing this public interface can provide the data needed by a EffectBarRenderer to create effect glyphs dynamically.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.EffectId
member.summary: Gets the unique effect name for this effect. (Used for grouping)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanShareBand
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect can share the space with other effects if required. (Example: tempo and dynamics don't share their space with other effects, a let-ring and palm-mute will share the space if possible)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.HideOnMultiTrack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect glyphs should only be added once on the first track if multiple tracks are rendered. (Example: this allows to render the tempo changes only once)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.ShouldCreateGlyph(AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether the given beat has the appropriate effect set and needs a glyph creation
member.param: the beat storing the data
member.returns: true if the beat has the effect set, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.SizingMode
member.summary: Gets the sizing mode of the glyphs created by this info.
member.returns: the sizing mode to apply to the glyphs during layout

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CreateNewGlyph(AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Creates a new effect glyph for the given beat.
member.param: the renderer which requests for glyph creation
the beat storing the data
member.returns: the glyph which needs to be added to the renderer

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanExpand(AlphaTab.Model.Beat,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether an effect glyph can be expanded to a particular beat.
member.param: the beat which already has the glyph applied
the beat which the glyph should get expanded to
member.returns: true if the glyph can be expanded, false if a new glyph needs to be created.

member.summary: This Factory procudes ScoreBarRenderer instances

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreRenderer
member.summary: This is the main wrapper of the rendering engine which can render a single track of a score object into a notation sheet.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo
member.summary: This public class stores size information about a stave. It is used by the layout engine to collect the sizes of score parts to align the parts across multiple staves.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo.Version
member.summary: an internal version number that increments whenever a change was made.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.MasterBarsRenderers
member.summary: This container represents a single column of bar renderers independent from any staves. This container can be used to reorganize renderers into a new staves.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff
member.summary: A Staff represents a single line within a StaveGroup. It stores BarRenderer instances created from a given factory.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.TrackIndex
member.summary: This is the index of the track being rendered. This is not the index of the track within the model, but the n-th track being rendered. It is the index of the array defining which tracks should be rendered. For single-track rendering this will always be zero.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveTop
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually start. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveBottom
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually ends. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup
member.summary: A Staff consists of a list of different staves and groups them using an accolade.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.IsFull
member.summary: Indicates whether this line is full or not. If the line is full the bars can be aligned to the maximum width. If the line is not full the bars will not get stretched.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.Width
member.summary: The width that the content bars actually need

member.summary: This BarRenderer renders a bar using guitar tablature notation

member.summary: This Factory produces TabBarRenderer instances

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper
member.summary: This small utilty public class allows the assignment of accidentals within a desired scope.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.KeySignatureLookup
member.summary: a lookup list containing an info whether the notes within an octave need an accidental rendered. the accidental symbol is determined based on the type of key signature.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.AccidentalNotes
member.summary: Contains the list of notes within an octave have accidentals set.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.StepsPerOctave
member.summary: We always have 7 steps per octave. (by a step the offsets inbetween score lines is meant, 0 steps is on the first line (counting from top) 1 steps is on the space inbetween the first and the second line

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.OctaveSteps
member.summary: Those are the amount of steps for the different clefs in case of a note value 0 [Neutral, C3, C4, F4, G2]

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.SharpNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for sharp keysignatures

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.FlatNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for flat keysignatures

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.ApplyAccidental(AlphaTab.Model.Note)
member.summary: Calculates the accidental for the given note and assignes the value to it. The new accidental type is also registered within the current scope

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Settings
member.summary: This public class contains instance specific settings for alphaTab

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Scale
member.summary: Sets the zoom level of the rendered notation

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Width
member.summary: The initial size of the canvas during loading or the width for particular layouts (e.g. page layout).

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Height
member.summary: The initial size of the canvas during loading or the fixed height on some layouts.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Engine
member.summary:
The engine which should be used to render the the tablature.
default - Platform specific default engine
html5 - Canvas with VRML Fallback
svg - SVG

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Layout
member.summary: The layout specific settings

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.StretchForce
member.summary: The default stretch force to use for layouting.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ForcePianoFingering
member.summary: Forces the fingering rendering to use always the piano finger stýle where fingers are rendered as 1-5 instead of p,i,m,a,c and T,1,2,3,4.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Staves
member.summary: The staves that should be shown in the music sheet. This is one of the profiles registered in the

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.Mode
member.summary:
The layouting mode used to arrange the the notation.
page - Bars are aligned in rows using a fixed width
horizontal - Bars are aligned horizontally in one row

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional layout mode specific settings. mode=page
barsPerRow - Limit the displayed bars per row, -1 for sized based limit (integer, default:-1)
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)
hideInfo - Render the song information or not (boolean, default:true)
mode=horizontal
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.Id
member.summary:
The stave profile name as it is registered in Default Profiles:
score-tab - Standard music notation and guitar tablature are rendered (default)
score - Only standard music notation is rendered
tab - Only guitar tablature is rendered

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional stave sspecific settings id=tab
rhythm - Renders rhythm beams to tablature notes

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Xml.XmlParser.XmlState
member.summary: faster than enum
